meanings.definition: The act of drawing or pulling something.
meanings.sent1: She won the game with a lucky tirage of the winning card.
meanings.sent2: The tirage of names from the hat determined the raffle winner.
meanings.sent3: The magician's tirage of a rabbit from the hat amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: His tirage of memories from the past brought tears to his eyes.
meanings.sent5: The sudden tirage of the curtain revealed the surprise party guests.

meanings.definition: The process of selecting or choosing something.
meanings.sent1: The tirage of flavors at the ice cream shop made it hard to decide.
meanings.sent2: Her tirage of the perfect outfit for the party took hours.
meanings.sent3: The tirage of toppings on the pizza was a fun challenge for the kids.
meanings.sent4: His tirage of words for the speech was thoughtful and well-received.
meanings.sent5: The tirage of books at the library offered endless possibilities for reading.

meanings.definition: The act of printing copies of a photograph or artwork.
meanings.sent1: The tirage of the artist's painting was displayed in the gallery.
meanings.sent2: The tirage of the family portrait turned out beautifully.
meanings.sent3: The tirage of the landscape photo captured the beauty of nature.
meanings.sent4: Her tirage of the artwork for the exhibition was a success.
meanings.sent5: The tirage of the old photograph brought back fond memories.
